-1.title: Episode dated 16 December 2017
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Snoopers
1.plot: Sam worries that Theresa May is watching him masturbate, Lembit Opik tells us what he really thinks of Nick Clegg and Bobby Mair finds out who the British public wants us to bomb next. Featuring guests Lou Sanders, Simon Evans, Matt Richardson and Lembit Opik.

2.title: Drugs
2.plot: Sam asks whether everyone in the world is on drugs, David Lammy MP reveals the secrets of the Privy Council and Bobby Mair tries out life under house arrest. Featuring guests Holly Burn, David Mills, Mae Martin and David Lammy MP.

3.title: Terrorism
3.plot: Sam looks at how everyone on Facebook is planning to stop ISIS, Bobby Mair hunts down extremists in Chipping Norton, and human rights campaigner Peter Tatchell explains why our government is doing exactly what the terrorists want. Featuring guests David Mills, Lou Sanders, Felicity Ward and Peter Tatchell.

4.title: War!
4.plot: Sam explains why we're teetering on the brink of Armageddon, Lord Prescott tells us what he really thinks about everyone in Parliament, and Bobby Mair storms the Canadian embassy. Featuring guests Iain Lee, Zoe Lyons, Joel Dommett and Lord Prescott.

5.title: Bombs
5.plot: Sam demonstrates why decisions on who to bomb aren't made on social media, Bobby Mair finds Jeremy Corbyn a new job and Johnny Mercer MP on why ISIS are "pretty sad." Featuring guests Stephen K. Amos, Felicity Ward, Giles Coren and Johnny Mercer MP.

6.title: Outrage
6.plot: Sam asks if moral outrage is out of control, MP Mike Freer speculates on Donald Trump's sexuality and Bobby Mair takes on Tyson Fury. Featuring guests Angela Barnes, Iain Lee, Henry Paker and Mike Freer MP.

7.title: Saudi Arabia
7.plot: Sam wonders why we're still mates with Saudi Arabia, feminist icon Germaine Greer explains her views on transgender people and reporter David Hock hunts down the illegal immigrants posing as Santa. Featuring guests David Mills, Harriet Kemsley, Holly Burn and Germaine Greer.

8.title: Christmas
8.plot: Sam's Christmas gift to you is a bunch of the best bits from previous shows with some of the country's best comics and special guest John Prescott.

1.title: New Year
1.plot: Sam looks back on the best bits of 2015 with highlights from our previous shows and special guests Germaine Greer, and MPs Mike Freer and Johnny Mercer.

2.title: North Korea Capers
2.plot: Sam reacts to North Korea's latest high jinx, David Lammy MP threatens to wrestle Oliver Letwin to the ground, and David Hock meets a friendly jihadist. Featuring guests Stephen K. Amos, Susie Boniface and Matt Richardson.

3.title: David Bowie
3.plot: Sam asks why Britain is so bad at mourning, Baron John Prescott eats an orange covered in OXO and Bobby Mair tries to get an interview with Joseph Kony. Featuring guests Giles Coren, Zoe Lyons, Des Clarke and Lord Prescott.

4.title: Racists
4.plot: Sam realises that the Oscars have always been racist, spin doctor Damian McBride reveals how Gordon Brown almost put tanks on the streets in 2008 and Bobby Mair finds that there's corruption in every sport. Featuring guests Felicity Ward, Jamie East, James Jordan and Damian McBride.

5.title: George Osborne
5.plot: Sam asks where it all went wrong for George Osborne, Yasmin Qureshi MP answers the internet's stupidest questions about Muslims and Bobby Mair forces the public to demean themselves for food. Featuring guests Stephen K. Amos, Lou Sanders, James Brown, Michael White and Yasmin Qureshi MP.

6.title: America
6.plot: Sam wishes our elections were as exciting as America's, Shaun Ryder tells us why he loved Maggie Thatcher, Ken Livingstone nominates John McDonnell to be next Labour leader, and Bobby Mair eats a gay cake. Featuring guests Shaun Ryder, Holly Burn, Fern Brady and Ken Livingstone.

7.title: Jeremy Hunt
7.plot: Sam uncovers a Tory conspiracy to put a 'Jeremy Hunt' in charge of the NHS, Bobby Mair invites the public to injure a celebrity and Lord Tim Bell reveals the inner mind of Margaret Thatcher. With guests Vanessa Feltz, Angela Barnes, David Mills and Lord Bell.

8.title: No Platform
8.plot: Sam wonders why the pro-Europe lobby are so bad at scaremongering compared to the Brexit mob, Bobby Mair goes crowdfunding Kanye West style, and Peter Tatchell defends students who are so right-on, they reckon even he's a fascist. With comedians Des Clarke and Iain Lee, and Susie Boniface AKA the Fleet Street Fox.

9.title: Boris
9.plot: Sam asks how Boris Johnson has been allowed to happen, former Conservative MP Jerry Hayes calls Boris a "hypocritical sh*t," and Bobby Mair investigates claim culture. With guests Giles Coren, Luisa Zissman, David Mills and Jerry Hayes.

10.title: Migrants
10.plot: Sam asks if anyone has a solution to the migrant crisis besides setting fire to it, Alastair Campbell dishes the dirt on the Blair years and Bobby Mair sticks up for badgers. With guests Rod Liddle, Vanessa Feltz, Felicity Ward and Alastair Campbell.

11.title: Censorship
11.plot: Sam tries to beat the ban on parliamentary footage in comedy shows, MP Michael Fabricant reveals exclusively that he used to be a spy. Featuring guests Johnny Mercer MP, Iain Lee, Holly Burn and Michael Fabricant MP.

12.title: Apologies
12.plot: Sam asks if Britain has gone apology-crazy and Lord Kinnock tells Jeremy Corbyn to smarten up. With guests Luisa Zissman, Zoe Lyons, Bobby Mair and Lord Kinnock.

13.title: Best Bits
13.plot: Sam looks back at the highlights of 2016 so far, including special guests and some bits you haven't seen before.

14.title: Steel: King of Metals
14.plot: Sam explains why everyone is suddenly really into steel, former Ukipper Janice Atkinson MEP claims that the BBC have stitched her up, and Bobby Mair goes to 'no-go area' Brixton. With guests Ayesha Hazarika, Holly Burn, James Brown and Janice Atkinson MEP.

15.title: Panama Papers
15.plot: Sam wonders what's new about rich people avoiding tax, Ken Livingstone admits he knows less about London than Zac Goldsmith, and Bobby Mair investigates the Grand National. With guests Vanessa Feltz, Des Clarke, Jerry Hayes and Ken Livingstone.

16.title: The Decline and Fall of David Cameron
16.plot: Sam realizes it's the end of days for David Cameron, Conservative MP Mike Freer sticks up for Jeremy Corbyn, and Hacked Off founder Brian Cathcart is grilled for details on Hugh Grant's sex life. With guests Karen Danczuk, Eddie 'The Eagle' Edwards, Des Clarke, Brian Cathcart and Mike Freer MP.

17.title: The Queen Must Be Destroyed
17.plot: Sam asks how we can end the tyrannical reign of Queen Elizabeth II, Ann Widdecombe tells Obama to butt out of the Brexit debate and Bobby Mair looks at the glamorous world of poverty tourism. With guests Shaun Ryder, Helen Wood and Iain Lee.

18.title: Labour's Racist Rebrand
18.plot: Sam looks at the Labour party's bold new foray into anti-semitism while Labour MP Rupa Huq does her best to defend it, and the panel gets heated over police complicity in the Hillsborough cover-up. With guests Alfie Moore, Simon Evans, Ayesha Hazarika, Alex Brummer and Rupa Huq MP.

19.title: All Hail President Trump
19.plot: Sam looks with despair at the mess Jeremy Corbyn has made of the local elections, Germaine Greer explains which parts of the EU are the most sexist, and we all look ahead to the presidency of Donald Trump. With guests Luisa Zissman, David Mills, Holly Burn and Germaine Greer.

20.title: The BBC: A Nation's Shame
20.plot: Sam explains why the BBC is one institution the Tories should dismantle, Neil Hamilton discusses his beef with Nigel Farage, and Bobby Mair visits the North Korean embassy. With guests Natasha Devon, Felicity Ward, Karen Danczuk and Neil Hamilton.

21.title: Terror-Noia
21.plot: Sam explains why we're wrong to be so paranoid about terrorism, Neil Kinnock explains why we should be terrified about Brexit, and Bobby Mair looks at the weirdest stories of the week. With guests Paul Danan, Zoe Lyons, Tania Edwards and Lord Neil Kinnock.

22.title: #votin
22.plot: Sam explains why all the cool kids are #votin to stay in the EU, Elizabeth Jones from UKIP answers our allegations that her party isn't racist enough. With Stephen K. Amos, Holly Burn, Helen Wood and Elizabeth Jones.

23.title: John Prescott's News Thing
23.plot: The nation's favourite Deputy, Lord Prescott, takes on Ken Livingstone as he holds the fort for Sam this week. With Fleet Street Fox Susie Boniface, and comedians Bobby Mair and Felicity Ward.

24.title: Holy Noel
24.plot: Now that Noel Edmonds has found a cure for cancer, Sam asks if there's anything the legendary ex-Radio 1 DJ can't do. And should Sir Philip Green be hanged from a tree by his BHS tie? With comedians Steve Furst, Ayesha Hazarika and Phil Whelans, and Labour MP Kate Hoey.

25.title: Hooligans
25.plot: Sam asks why everyone forgot that plain old yobbery would be the biggest threat at Euro 2016 - and what exactly is a flotilla? With Vanessa Feltz, comedians Angela Barnes and David Mills and legendary pollster Sir Robert Worcester.

26.title: The Clip Show
26.plot: Assuming we've still all got electricity, Sam will be back with a Brexit special next week. For now take your mind off imminent Armageddon with a selection of our favourite moments from 2016.

27.title: Brapocalypse
27.plot: Sam surveys the blood-spattered ruins of post-Brexit Britain, Vince Cable explains why a Lib-Dem/Labour coalition is the only way forward, and Jeremy Corbyn worries that his roses needed pruning. With Shaun Ryder, Holly Burn, Des Clarke, Alex Brummer and Vince Cable.

28.title: Chilcot
28.plot: Sam asks if we need to give Tony Blair a break, Tory MP James Cleverly gives his view on his party's leadership contest, and Bobby Mair celebrates the demise of Nigel Farage. With guests Iain Lee, Felicity Ward, Karen Danczuk and James Cleverly.

29.title: David Cameron's Sausage Party
29.plot: Sam looks back on David Cameron's legacy - a broken economy and a canceled barbecue. Also, former Labour policy adviser John McTernan asks whether Jeremy Corbyn has a mandate to be useless, and SuperMassiveRaver surveys post-Brexit Britain with guests Pat Kane, Ayesha Hazarika, Bobby Mair, and John McTernan.

30.title: Who the F*** Is Owen Smith?
30.plot: Sam finds out if Owen Smith is as normal as he says he is, we ask Natalie Bennett why being green is such a pain in the ass, and we hear from our new foreign affairs correspondent, Cutthroat Mike. With guests David Mills, Susie Boniface, Fern Brady and Natalie Bennett.

31.title: Stop Sh***Ing Yourself
31.plot: Sam tells everyone to calm down - the world isn't that bad, UKIP's Steven Woolfe warns about the dangers of immigration, Bobby Mair is sucked into the world of Pokemon Go and Beyonce makes a live studio appearance. With guests Paul Danan, Steve Furst, Tania Edwards, Steven Woolfe and Beyonce.

32.title: Simon Danczuk: Sex Laureate
32.plot: Sam gets to the root of Simon Danczuk's sext addiction, UKIP leadership contender Elizabeth Jones stands up for golliwogs and Bobby Mair launches his own protest against Byron Burger. With guests Iain Lee, Angela Barnes, Phil Whelans and Elizabeth Jones.

33.title: Nigel Farage's Moustache
33.plot: Sam asks if Trump has finally reached peak mental and Nigel Farage premieres his new facial hair while boasting about how he destroyed the BNP. With Scott Capurro, Bob Mills, Natasha Devon, and Nigel Farage.

34.title: News Thing Summer Special
34.plot: Sam looks back at some of the highlights of the last few weeks, including Boris Johnson's appointment as foreign secretary, David Cameron's dodgy honors list, and how Brexit has just made us more European than ever. With special guest Natalie Bennett.

35.title: Jeremy Liar
35.plot: Sam wonders whether Jeremy Corbyn will ever be good at anything, and asks if the burkini ban proves that the French have finally gone mad, while George Galloway explains what it would take for him to rejoin the Labour Party - with Susie Boniface, James Brown, Bobby Mair and George Galloway.

36.title: News Thing Summer Special II
36.plot: With Sam on holidays again, we look back at some of the best bits from the last few weeks, including Simon Danczuk's sext addiction, Bobby Mair's real-life Pokemon Go and Nigel Farage's mustache.

37.title: Sex Edition
37.plot: Sam explains why Keith Vaz's penchant for rent boys makes him a man of principal, and Simon Danczuk MP reveals why he never had sex on his constituency desk. With Scott Capurro, Vanessa Feltz, and Tania Edwards.

38.title: Go on Then David Cameron, F**K Off!
38.plot: Sam reassesses David Cameron's already terrible legacy in the light of the Libya report, while Greg Dyke tells us why Bake Off really doesn't matter. Plus, we hear from George Galloway and Ken Livingstone. With Felicity Ward, Iain Lee and Bobby Mair.

39.title: Brangelexit
39.plot: Sam asks if William Hague is the mysterious third party in the Brangelina break-up and Corbynista Aaron Bastani reveals why he once smashed up an HSBC. With guests Fern Brady, Susie Boniface and David Mills.

40.title: Big Sam's Big Mouth
40.plot: Sam uncovers more secret recordings from the Sam Allardyce sting, Bobby Mair is forced to sit through the Trump/Clinton debate, and MP Mike Freer tells us why Theresa May is trying to keep her hands off Brexit. With Steve Furst, Angela Barnes and Zoe Lyons.

41.title: One-Punch Hookem
41.plot: Sam looks at UKIP's Mike Hookem, the MEP who can kill a man with one punch, Alastair Campbell takes us on a journey into the mind of Tony Blair, we review the impossibly glamorous Kardashian heist and hear from Diana in Heaven. With Vanessa Feltz, Bobby Mair, and Karen Danczuk.

42.title: Paul Nuttall's Detailed Psychometric Evaluation
42.plot: Sam explains the Brexit negotiations through the medium of Sylvanian Families, while potential UKIP leader Paul Nuttall is subjected to a psychiatric exam, and Bobby Mair tries to change the public's opinion of killer clowns. With guests Shaun Ryder, Luisa Omielan and Susie Boniface.

43.title: Ken Livingstone Sings Phil Collins
43.plot: Sam asks why we're obsessed with refugees' teeth, Bobby Mair reads the internet to Julian Assange, and special guest Ken Livingstone talks the refugee crisis and Easy Lover. With Iain Lee, Maddy Anholt and Holly Burn.

44.title: Heathrow's Boring Runway
44.plot: Sam asks if anyone actually cares about the third runway at Heathrow, UKIP's Raheem Kassam shoots his mouth off and Bobby Mair goes undercover in the high street stores that exploit child refugees. With Felicity Ward, Paul Danan and Tanya Edwards.

45.title: Countdown to Trumpageddon
45.plot: Sam asks if anyone actually cares about the third runway at Heathrow, UKIP's Raheem Kassam shoots his mouth off and Bobby Mair goes undercover in the high street stores that exploit child refugees. With Felicity Ward, Paul Danan and Tanya Edwards.

46.title: Live from Washington DC
46.plot: In a US election special filmed in Washington DC, Sam visits the White House to warn people of Trumpageddon and asks if American voters are maniacs or geniuses. And former Clinton adviser Richard Goodstein tries to explain how Hillary Clinton lost the easiest election ever. With guests Scott Capurro and Niki Moore.

47.title: Don't Worry Be Happy
47.plot: Sam explains that Donald Trump's election is not the end of the world, Nigel Evans MP talks Brexit and Yewtree, and Bobby Mair finds out if the public really believes everything they read on Facebook. With Iain lee, Felicity Ward, and Michelle Dewbury.

48.title: Nigel Farage's Big Gold Lift
48.plot: Nigel Farage explains why he's trying to do the British ambassador to the US out of his job, while Sam asks why we even bother with the Autumn Statement. With Susie Boniface, Bon Ofoedu, and Scott Capurro.

49.title: Christian Wolmar Gets His Deposit Back
49.plot: Sam explains why the Lib Dems' by-election win is the most seismic political moment of 2016, and defeated Labour candidate Christian Wolmar attempts to win back his £500 deposit.

50.title: Boris Johnson V Saudi Arabia
50.plot: Sam examines Boris Johnson's latest diplomatic snafu and Eamonn Holmes tells us everything that's wrong with modern media. With Zoe Lyons, Babatunde and Holly Burn.

51.title: 2016 Best. Year. Ever!
51.plot: Sam counts down the best moments from what most people are calling the greatest year in human history, including politician sex scandals, the UKIP fist-fight, and that gorilla that drank 5 liters of Ribena. Meanwhile, David Davies MP tries to make the case for refugee dental checks. With guests Scott Capurro, Felicity Ward and Bobby Mair.

1.title: A Nigel Farage Piñata
1.plot: Sam asks if Russia really has hacked the whole of America, space expert Sarah Cruddas explains how scared we should be of the end of our world, and UKIP Deputy Leader Peter Whittle goes deep into Brexit negotiations while playing with his Nigel Farage birthday piñata. With Carey Marx, Natasha Devon, and David Mills.

2.title: Trump's Golden Era
2.plot: Sam asks what else we could make up about Donald Trump - seeing as everyone else is - and has a few choice words for Jeremy Corbyn. With Bobby Mair, Iain Lee, Zoe Lyons, and Luisa Zissman.

3.title: America's Last President
3.plot: Sam celebrates the inauguration of Donald Trump and the coming end of days with an all-American panel. Peter Tatchell tells us why it's time for the special relationship to end, and Bobby Mair holds a funeral for the American dream. With David Mills, Erich McElroy, and Kate Andrews.

4.title: Stop Talking Trump
4.plot: Sam explains why taking the piss out of Donald Trump is playing right into his hands, while Donald Trump's pastor Mark Burns tries to convince us that the president is not a racist. With Marlon Davis, Susie Boniface and Fern Brady.

5.title: An Idiot's Guide to Brexit
5.plot: Sam gives us a simplified account of the Brexit vote, Conservative MP Kwasi Kwarteng gives a proper one, and the panel keep their eye on Donald Trump. With Marek Larwood, Holly Burn and Geoff Norcott.

6.title: Shut It Bercow!
6.plot: Sam asks if John Bercow has stepped out of line with his ban on Donald Trump, and former MP Jerry Hayes explains why the speaker may soon be out of a job. The panel also sift through David Beckham's e-mails and former Labour adviser John McTernan suggests it's time for Tony Blair to come back. With panelists Evelyn Mok, David Mills and Maddy Anholt.

7.title: Keeping Up with the Kim-Jong-Ashians
7.plot: Sam looks at the latest developments in the Kim Jong family, Ann Widdecombe weighs in on Brexit and prison reform, and the panel assess just how much of a dickhead Piers Morgan really is. With Zoe Lyons, Sandi Bogle and Erich McElroy.

imdb.title: Sam Delaney's News Thing
plot: Sam Delaney takes an irreverent look at the week in news, joined by a panel of comedians and a top political guest.
